pullrequest.title: fixed analysis loop freezing after script restart

content.raw:
Fantastic, I was wondering about this problem, as this bit me too recently.

I'll test briefly before merging. Thanks!
content.html:

pullrequest.title: fixed analysis loop freezing after script restart

content.raw:
This happened quite often in our lab in the last time \(lots of misjudgment considering runtime of scripts\) which made this worth looking into.

Putting a error into `self.from_worker` might not be the most elegant solution, as it pauses the queue\(could be a good thing sometimes\) and the newly started analysis script is marked as being in a error state, but it gets the job done in the cases where one needs to actually restart a script to cancel it's execution.
content.html:
This happened quite often in our lab in the last time (lots of misjudgment considering runtime of scripts) which made this worth looking into.

Putting a error into self.from_worker might not be the most elegant solution, as it pauses the queue(could be a good thing sometimes) and the newly started analysis script is marked as being in a error state, but it gets the job done in the cases where one needs to actually restart a script to cancel it's execution.

pullrequest.title: fixed analysis loop freezing after script restart

content.raw:
I think this is fine, the analysis routine was terminated mid-run, so I'd count that as an error. Auto-running the restarted one is presumptuous, especially if it's just going to crash again.

This is the exact sort of reason I gave the `ReadQueue`s a `put()` method - I think we do this in BLACS when restarting tabs. So it makes perfect sense.
content.html:
I think this is fine, the analysis routine was terminated mid-run, so I'd count that as an error. Auto-running the restarted one is presumptuous, especially if it's just going to crash again.

This is the exact sort of reason I gave the ReadQueues a put() method - I think we do this in BLACS when restarting tabs. So it makes perfect sense.
